meanings.definition: A carnivorous mammal of the dog family with a pointed muzzle and bushy tail, known for its cunning and sly behavior.
meanings.sent1: The fox quietly stalked its prey through the forest.
meanings.sent2: I saw a fox running across the field yesterday.
meanings.sent3: The fox tried to outsmart the farmer by stealing his chickens.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes gleamed like a fox's, full of cleverness and mischief.
meanings.sent5: The cunning fox outwitted the hunter with its quick thinking.

meanings.sent1: She tried to fox her friends by pretending to be someone else.
meanings.sent2: He wanted to fox his opponent in the game of chess.
meanings.sent3: The magician used sleight of hand to fox the audience.
meanings.sent4: His smooth talking could easily fox anyone into believing his lies.
meanings.sent5: The con artist managed to fox the entire town with his elaborate scheme.

meanings.sent1: She was a sly fox when it came to negotiating deals.
meanings.sent2: The old man was known as the clever fox of the village.
meanings.sent3: The cunning fox always had a trick up his sleeve.
meanings.sent4: He was a fox in business, always finding a way to come out on top.
meanings.sent5: The clever fox knew how to navigate any tricky situation with ease.
